problem_text:
Does every finite group G contain a pair of conjugate elements a, b such that π(G) = π(⟨a, b⟩)? This is true for soluble groups.
Comment of 2013: it was proved in (A. Lucchini, M. Morigi, P. Shumyatsky, Forum Math., 24 (2012), 875–887) that every finite group G contains a 2-generator subgroup H such that π(G) = π(H).
P. Shumyatsky
